hackathon-description-text: HopHacks is a student-run, 36 hour Hackathon. This event brings engineers, designers and entreprenuers together to explore new ideas, compete for prizes and create amazing applications. It allows skilled students to showcase their hard work and knowledge. The great applications students build in the 36 hours are supposed to be a starting point for world changing ideas.
hackathon-eligibility:
Any university student, regardless of university, may participate. Graduate and undergraduate students from all departments and divisions are welcome. 
You must register online and receive email confirmation before attending. Please be prepared to show your University ID upon check-in.
hackathon-requirements: At the end of the hackathon, your team can submit a project on ChallengePost. Your project will then be judged during your 2 minute presentation during our scheduled presentation time.

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Awarded to the team with the highest overall score from the judges
Awarded to the team with the second highest overall score from the judges
Awarded to the team with the third highest overall score from the judges
Awarded to the Judges' choice for Honorable Mention
The team that has the best use of the the Bloomberg API, as judged by Bloomberg employees, will receive a GoPro camera
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Best Use of the Bloomberg API

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Awarded to the team with the best use of reverse engineering hardware or software to interface with a device/sensor. The winning team will receive $100 in Amazon gift cards.
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Booz Allen Hamilton Reverse Engineering - 1st Place

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Awarded to the team with the second best use of reverse engineering hardware or software to interface with a device/sensor. The winning team will receive $50 in Amazon gift cards.
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Booz Allen Hamilton Reverse Engineering - 2nd Place

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Awarded to the team with the third best use of reverse engineering hardware or software to interface with a device/sensor. The winning team will receive $25 in Amazon gift cards.
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Booz Allen Hamilton Reverse Engineering - 3rd Place

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Awarded by IBM to the team with the best use of Bluemix and Watson. The winning team will get a meeting with a Watson Specialist.
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Best Use of IBM Bluemix and Watson

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Awarded to the team with the best use of the Dropbox API. The winning team will receive 100GB of Dropbox space.
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Best Use of the Dropbox API

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: The Imprivata sponsored prize will go to the top medical-related hack. The hack will be evaluated based on difficulty, creativity, and execution. The winning team will receive two sets of Bose in-ear headphones and one $100 Amazon gift card.

The Imprivata sponsored prize will go to the top medical-related hack. The hack will be evaluated based on difficulty, creativity, and execution. The winning team will receive one $100 Amazon gift card.
Awarded by MLH for the best use of the Myo. Each member of the winning team will receive a Myo.

hackathon-judging-criteria.judging-criterion: Judges will rate how polished your product and code looks, so make sure you submit the neat stuff!
Judges will rate how well your product fills its intended need.
Judge will rate how unique and innovative your idea is.
Judges will rate how advanced your design and execution is, so don't be modest!

hackathon-description-header: Join HopHacks for 36 hours of coding, hardware hacking, free food and swag!
